channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Amazon gadget boss hints at ‘awesome’ future Alexa products and unveils a slew of new Kindle devices in his public debut
item.description: Amazon's Panos Panay hinted that the new Alexa would elicit "emotion" and "connection." “The products coming,” he added, “are pretty awesome.”

item.title: Silicon Valley is pouring billions into nuclear energy because without it, the U.S. risks ‘browning the grid’
item.description: Announcements from Google, Microsoft, and Amazon could be the “inflection point” that makes scaling up AI truly possible.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Strikes Near Beirut For First Time in Days
item.description: The attacks, which also hit southern Lebanon, came after the United States expressed concerns about the bombardment of the Lebanese capital. Israel’s ...

item.title: Israel Allows Some Aid Into Northern Gaza After U.S. Warning
item.description: There was no official response from the Israeli government, a day after the United States threatened consequences if it didn’t let more relief into Ga...

item.title: Is Brazil’s Supreme Court Saving Democracy or Threatening It?
item.description: Brazil’s top court expanded its power to protect democracy. But some are wondering whether the court now represents the threat.

item.title: Lufthansa Fined $4 Million for Stopping Jewish Passengers From Boarding Plane
item.description: The Transportation Department handed out a record fine after the airline prevented 128 travelers from making a connecting flight in 2022.

item.title: On average, every high school has one ‘ultra-high-earning’ teen who makes $10,000 via online hustles
item.description: Thanks to TikTok, Depop, and Twitch, making money online has replaced the paper round.

item.title: Economists say America’s gender wage gap is getting worse again—the first major setback for working women in 20 years
item.description: The Labor Department’s chief economist said it’s too soon to tell whether 2023 was a blip or the start of a worrisome new trend.

item.title: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson knows about working with people you disagree with—and learned this strategy from her own mentor
item.description: "One of the most important things is to try not to take anything personally."

item.title: Push for High-Rise Next to Brooklyn Botanic Garden Becomes Battle Over Shadows
item.description: The Brooklyn Botanic Garden and its supporters are fighting a proposal to build a 14-story apartment building that would cast shadows on the garden.

item.title: Paul Lowe, Award-Winning British Photojournalist, Dies at 60
item.description: He was killed in a stabbing near Los Angeles, and his 19-year-old son was arrested, the authorities said. Mr. Lowe earned acclaim for documenting the ...

item.title: Is Brazil’s Supreme Court Saving Democracy or Threatening It?
item.description: Brazil’s top court expanded its power to protect democracy. But some are wondering whether the court now represents the threat.

item.title: Fuel Tanker Explosion Leaves at Least 90 Dead in Nigeria
item.description: Residents of a nearby town came to scoop up the spilled gasoline, but then the tanker exploded, setting off an inferno — an echo of several similar di...

item.title: Fleeing Israeli Bombs, the Displaced in Lebanon Search for Safety
item.description: Schools, clubs and parks have become places of refuge as the displaced seek safety amid Israeli bombings.
